main event: An unidentified object was observed on a ground-radar scope over the Pacific area on July 3, 1961.
interesting points: The object was moving at an extremely high speed of approximately 4-5 thousand miles per hour., The radar operator indicated that the radar trace did not appear to be consistent with standard aircraft., The observation lasted for about 10 minutes before the object disappeared., The object's trajectory was recorded at a course of 335 degrees., Various conclusions regarding the nature of the object, including possibilities such as aircraft, satellite, balloon, or astronomical phenomenon, were drawn.
witness description: the radar operator who monitored the object
